intro: Pseuduvaria taipingensis, commonly known as the Taiping pseuduvaria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Anacardiaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like Thailand and Malaysia. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or greenish-yellow in color. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in lowland forests or secondary growth areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and less-studied species within its family.
